document.title: National Healthcare Foundation Standards and Accountability Criteria

jurisdiction.title: National Consortium for Health Science Education

A18419D0F11C4F28BC7817F2DCF35711.description: Demonstrate use of appropriate email and social media usage.

4ED8F6EBC74E4C64AA65D4647FDC2906.description: Evaluate the validity of web-based resources.

8EEB66140A0C4FFB8B5C76E0F76034E1.description: Use basic word processing, spreadsheet, and database applications.

2DDCC9A39DB949E2B6BFFFCC98DE0E52.description: Demonstrate use of file organization and information storage.

F1FF064E61AE40C9BAA3F615BCF50F41.description: Apply basic computer concepts and terminology in order to use computers and other mobile devices.

1CCD8BF2EDE24CD6BF9CB5BE0BEBFDF8.description: Describe appropriate methods to correct inaccurate information/errors personally entered into an electronic medical record (EMR).

2CA34DBBF2B14384852D44837925E4D1.description: Describe the consequences of inappropriate use of health data in terms of disciplinary action.

5E1AFC9C03F4448EB3CADF98A7851314.description: Identify and apply policies and procedures for access and disclosure of personal health information.

C9C8D310FD9C459E84AB1529F43AD67B.description: Identify legal and regulatory requirements related to the use of personal health information.

58F2E4E291F546D4A25B5348D7BA3782.description: Apply the fundamentals of privacy and confidentiality policies and procedures.

D58A31E2CD1D43A3B49F055D21C7D5D5.description: Privacy and Confidentiality of Health Information

32E2A7D1A83D4B49B896EF1A59C09778.description: Adhere to information systems policies and procedures as required by national, state, local, and organizational levels.

A8E29146C81248BE953A075EF42EDB2F.description: Create documentation in the health record that reflects timeliness, completeness, and accuracy.

6F4CAC6238CE4383977202D0E9F7FEB5.description: Differentiate between types and content of health records (patient, pharmacy, and laboratory).

FD41DE7D27F14409AD8A683AA5863005.description: Use health record data collection tools (such as input screens, document templates).

177306B286F3433C8F5D354792E52364.description: Identify methods and types of data collected in healthcare.

comments: Healthcare professionals will use information technology applications required within all career specialties. They will demonstrate use as appropriate to healthcare applications.

89C072C0A26E4D2D96F43F9775AF1A37.description: Apply skills to obtain training or certification in cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR), automated external defibrillator (AED), foreign body airway obstruction (FBAO) and first aid.

882B7218946A4D63919E180B8C8B8838.description: Apply procedures for measuring and recording vital signs including the normal ranges.

comments: Healthcare professionals will apply technical skills required for all career specialties. They will demonstrate skills and knowledge as appropriate.
Additional technical skills may be included in a program of study based on career specialties.

1D6CC2EF068B4ABA9EFA63BEDAA9E111.description: Investigate complementary (alternative) health practices as they relate to wellness and disease prevention.

7A58BCD01E4443319DB50BBA045B52EE.description: Describe strategies for the prevention of diseases including health screenings and examinations.

4CDCFEAEAE9945B18EAEAF5E567056B0.description: Apply behaviors that promote health and wellness.

comments: Healthcare professionals will understand the fundamentals of wellness and the prevention of disease processes. They will practice preventive health behaviors among the clients.

9D539B991695472F955D73509CB3A4E1.description: Apply effective techniques for managing team conflict.

08793CF34A4F44BD967D01B3D49D7903.description: Analyze attributes and attitudes of an effective leader.

4DB5B786938F4EABBF6067D8D87D19E9.description: Differentiate creative methods for building positive team relationships.

51F33E62ADE44CFCB8C68B75FA45560A.description: Understand roles and responsibilities of team members.

comments: Healthcare professionals will understand the roles and responsibilities of individual members as part of the healthcare team, including their ability to promote the delivery of quality healthcare. They will interact effectively and sensitively with all members of the healthcare team.

5EBE3EA8184C48B79F5108A0FCD7954B.description: Apply principles of basic emergency response in natural disasters and other emergencies.

69A2E0FFE9D84E5EBFC73C40BF999E1E.description: Practice fire safety in a healthcare setting.

41BA9F097DD8451AB8BDB67055F81A23.description: Comply with safety signs, symbols, and labels.

541085B3DD564DBE8EE921952BAF36AC.description: Apply safety techniques in the work environment.

F04A150CBA2C4848A6BC0067E1AB1496.description: Apply personal safety procedures based on Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) and Centers for Disease Control (CDC) regulations.

E9A75637C20B4A2F827CA06EA51C0556.description: Assess methods of controlling the spread and growth of microorganisms.

comments: Healthcare professionals will understand the existing and potential hazards to clients, co-workers, and self. They will prevent injury or illness through safe work practices and follow health and safety policies and procedures.

FE403611A3C742408EA1FE3B5048703D.description: Demonstrate respectful and empathetic treatment of ALL patients/clients (customer service).

CFAED6393A2E43A19EA54F6F0FF309DA.description: Research religious and cultural values as they impact healthcare and develop plans/guidelines for addressing cultural diversity.

01CFB9F5B15C4FA38895214FF255F69F.description: Utilize procedures for reporting activities and behaviors that affect the health, safety, and welfare of others.

56C338E7F64D430799B0144A24DAE2B6.description: Recognize ethical issues and their implications related to healthcare.

906489FD176E4A9CB040AB9F13A8379C.description: Differentiate between ethical and legal issues impacting healthcare.

comments: Healthcare professionals will understand accepted ethical practices with respect to cultural, social, and ethnic differences within the healthcare environment. They will perform quality healthcare delivery.

5FAA46CBC2924DB99910CE415B2833CE.description: Differentiate laws governing harassment, labor and scope of practice.

B315B9DAA66447F9A8E8A03FDA844B63.description: Summarize the essential characteristics of a patient's basic rights within a healthcare setting.

DC1C347DC834498993CE75BF471F56FD.description: Apply standards for the privacy and confidentiality of health information (HIPAA).

264282DEB9F9454F9F4EB9C0931B7662.description: Apply procedures for accurate documentation and use of electronic and print health records.

comments: Healthcare professionals will understand the legal responsibilities, limitations, and implications of their actions within the healthcare delivery setting. They will perform their duties according to regulations, policies, laws and legislated rights of clients.

EFF7413AA8DD4BF78A4CBB2FEEBCB733.description: Identify innovative strategies for obtaining employment.

FAF776F9A25E4779B9161B6A88EF081A.description: Develop components of a personal portfolio.

AAE0E059C6BA4A9E93FCCE75FF43E8BE.description: Compare careers within the health science career pathways (diagnostic services, therapeutic services, health informatics, support services, or biotechnology research and development).

7375859408964CA9A6E70CDA614C9E77.description: Discuss levels of education, credentialing requirements, and employment trends in healthcare.

B794CAFDAB10419AA4A90E2885F5DA44.description: Summarize professional standards as they apply to hygiene, dress, language, confidentiality and behavior.

48CB39CE88704B1DB32D92082570DB8E.description: Classify the personal traits and attitudes desirable in a member of the healthcare team.

7117053B7AB74A329388725540CAED31.description: Personal Traits of the Healthcare Professional

comments: Healthcare professionals will understand how employability skills enhance their employment opportunities and job satisfaction. They will demonstrate key employability skills and will maintain and upgrade skills, as needed.

66C0365CFB2944C5A62673254C15CCDD.description: Discuss healthcare economics and common methods of payment for healthcare.

B42C479BEE4349E38E1D990713B453AC.description: Assess the impact of emerging issues on healthcare delivery systems.

F6BD3CD07E02475DB471A70ECEECD518.description: Describe the responsibilities of consumers within the healthcare system.

D7DA9D105101494693B923CD53AEB7CE.description: Understand the healthcare delivery system (public, private, government, and non-profit).

comments: Healthcare professionals will understand how their role fits into their department, their organization and the overall healthcare environment. They will identify how key systems affect services they perform and quality of care.

3CDF8C0BE8DA472BB39AB1E9CE6858E2.description: Prepare examples of technical, informative, and creative writing.

B30AA2523199470FB1B39FEB77980403.description: Critique elements of written and electronic communication (spelling, grammar, and formatting).

93B65FE25E7741839991CDE8B1AE9B78.description: Use medical abbreviations to communicate information.

67C116DBB27349AC904A6E3C9E24C942.description: Use roots, prefixes, and suffixes to communicate information.

1246F1DEB7B04C3CBDD7009F7ABFB051.description: Modify communication to meet the needs of the patient/client and to be appropriate to the situation.

C18122644D244D5FAB6EBF272345438B.description: Apply speaking and active listening skills.

8852D02682B9486DB53134EA45BD59EF.description: Interpret the elements of communication using a basic sender-receiver-feedback model.

comments: Healthcare professionals will know the various methods of giving and obtaining information. They will communicate effectively, both orally and in writing.

E9F2598F67674DA1BEB29F6E3F3DA13E.description: Analyze diagrams, charts, graphs, and tables to interpret healthcare results.

586C669420094DE5A1D6277D67F214EB.description: Apply mathematical computations related to healthcare procedures (metric and household, conversions and measurements).

48FE712E01B94D3AB40E09E0DDB6CF51.description: Investigate biomedical therapies as they relate to the prevention, pathology, and treatment of disease.

78DA4833097140B497C9B385663AE054.description: Research common diseases and disorders of each body system (prevention, pathology, diagnosis, and treatment).

AF1AF1898FC34CDEA65AB49E23D748B1.description: Analyze the basic structure and function of the human body.

6A181BCFD8E542A0AC16A3BE7EE5E034.description: Recognize body planes, directional terms, quadrants, and cavities.

202BAABCC0BC4ECF954E66BC468AEFFB.description: Classify the basic structural and functional organization of the human body (tissue, organ, and system).

comments: Healthcare professionals will know the academic subject matter required for proficiency within their area. They will use this knowledge as needed in their role. The following accountability criteria are considered essential for students in a health science program of study.
